sections.title: Intro & Prerequisites
sections.summary: Introduces the goal (deploying two models used by the demo) and lists required tools to run the demo locally.
key_actions: Understand demo goal: deploy two models used locally
Ensure prerequisites are installed

sections.title: Login to Azure (tenant) and Prepare to Create Resources
sections.summary: Logs into Azure using the tenant option to access the correct subscription and prepares to run the command that creates the resource group.
key_actions: Run `az login --tenant <tenant-id>` (or equivalent) to authenticate to the Cloud Advocate tenant
Prepare to run the resource-group creation command

sections.title: Create Resource Group & Capture Output
sections.summary: Runs the command to create a resource group (named in the demo), waits for completion, and retrieves the output JSON including keys and IDs.
key_actions: Run the command that creates the new resource group (e.g., scripted deployment)
Wait for the process to complete (~2 minutes)
Use CLI output to retrieve resource IDs and keys
ui_elements: Copy buttons/helpers implied for copying IDs/keys

sections.title: Get Endpoint & Foundry Name, Update Script
sections.summary: Shows commands to display endpoint and 'foundry' name, copies those values, updates a local script with resource and account names, then runs it to obtain a connection string.
key_actions: Run command to show the endpoint and foundry name
Copy the foundry/resource/account name
Edit the small script to insert resource group and account name
Run the script to produce the connection string
ui_elements: Terminal/console (where script is edited and executed)

sections.title: Dashboard Prompt: AI Foundry Parameter & Save to User Secrets
sections.summary: When running the app for the first time, the dashboard indicates the missing AI Foundry parameter. The value is pasted and saved to user secrets so the app can run and be tested (including semantic search).
key_actions: Locate the AI Foundry parameter prompt in the dashboard
Paste the connection/parameter value into the dashboard field
Save the value to user secrets to persist it
Start and browse the running application
Test features such as semantic search
ui_elements: App UI (product browsing and semantic search)

sections.title: Edit User Secrets to Point to a Different Resource
sections.summary: Shows how to edit the APP host's user secrets to change or remove the AI Foundry parameter and re-add it when switching to another resource.
key_actions: Open APP host and edit user secrets
Locate AI Foundry entry, delete it, then run and re-add updated value

sections.title: Inspect Resource Group & Azure OpenAI Deployments
sections.summary: Navigate to the created Azure resource group and open the Azure OpenAI (or OpenAI) blade to verify deployments. Confirms two deployments: GPT-4o-mini for chats/text generation and ADI O2 for embeddings, and notes endpoints/keys are available in portal.
key_actions: Open Azure Portal -> Resource Group
Open Azure OpenAI (OpenAI) resource in the group
Verify deployments (GPT-4o-mini, text embedding, ADI O2 for embeddings)
Copy endpoint and key values from portal

main_topics: Deploying demo models and required prerequisites
Azure CLI authentication and resource group creation
Retrieving outputs: endpoints, keys, and foundry/account names
Configuring local application with AI Foundry parameter
Saving and editing user secrets for configuration
Verifying Azure OpenAI deployments in the Azure portal
